paragraph.leadIn: not being any of the following persons, and without reasonable excuse, enters or is in a hotel or guesthouse within the meaning of section 20 while a remedial order is in force in respect of the hotel or guesthouse—

subparagraph.content: a police officer or an enforcement officer in the course of the officer’s duty;
a person authorized under section 20(5)(b);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: not being any of the following persons, and without reasonable excuse, enters or is in any premises while a closure order is in force in respect of the premises—

subparagraph.content: a police officer or an enforcement officer in the course of the officer’s duty;
a bailiff authorized by a warrant issued under section 20B to enter the premises;
a person assisting the bailiff in executing the warrant; or

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, interferes with anything used to close any premises subject to a remedial order or closure order. (Replaced 6 of 2020 s. 23)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: An authorized person who in or in connection with an authorized person’s certificate makes any statement or furnishes information which is false in any material particular and which the person knows or reasonably ought to know is false in such particular commits an offence. (Added 39 of 1998 s. 11. Amended 6 of 2020 s. 23)

Any person who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues. (Amended 6 of 2020 s. 23)

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution of summary offences
section.leadIn: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings may be instituted for an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Ordinance within whichever of the following periods ends last—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 6 months after the commission of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 6 months after the offence is discovered by or comes to the notice of the Authority.

section.name: s21B
section.heading: Liability of officers of body corporate

subsection.leadIn: If a body corporate commits an offence under this Ordinance, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of an officer of the body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of an officer of the body corporate,

subsection.continued: the officer also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

section.name: s21C
section.heading: Liability of partners, office holders, etc. of unincorporated bodies

subsection.leadIn: If a partner in a partnership commits an offence under this Ordinance, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a person specified in subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of a person specified in subsection (3),

subsection.continued: that person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of an unincorporated body other than a partnership commits an offence under this Ordinance, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a person specified in subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is attributable to any neglect on the part of a person specified in subsection (4),

subsection.continued: that person also commits the offence.

subsection.leadIn: The person referred to in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partner in the partnership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person concerned in the management of the partnership;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an office holder in the partnership; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: The person referred to in subsection (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person concerned in the management of the body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an office holder of the body; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person purporting to act in the capacity of a person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s21D
section.heading: Appointment of enforcement officer
section.content: The Authority may appoint in writing any public officer to be an enforcement officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s21E
section.heading: Duty to produce evidence of authority
section.leadIn: A person who, on any premises, exercises a power under section 18, 18A, 20 or 20B in respect of the premises must, if requested, produce for inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: documentary evidence of the person’s identity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a power exercised pursuant to a warrant issued under section 18A or 20B—the warrant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a power exercised by a person authorized under section 20(5)(b)—documentary evidence of the authorization; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a power exercised by an enforcement officer—documentary evidence of the appointment under section 21D.

subsection.content: In any legal proceedings, a copy purporting to be certified by a relevant authority as a true copy of a document or part of a document given, issued or maintained by the authority is admissible in evidence without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, is taken as so certified by the authority.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a document purporting to be given or issued by a relevant authority and purporting to be signed by the authority or any person authorized by the authority in that behalf is admissible in evidence without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken as given or issued by the authority and as so signed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is evidence of the facts stated in it.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a document purporting to be given or issued by an enforcement officer and purporting to be signed by the officer is admissible in evidence without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken as given or issued by the officer and as so signed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is evidence of the facts stated in it.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant authority (有關當局) means—(a)the Authority; or(b)the Secretary.

subsection.content: A person to whom this section applies is not civilly liable for an act done or omitted to be done by the person in good faith in performing or purportedly performing a function under this Ordinance.
Subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a bailiff; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person assisting an enforcement officer or a bailiff under section 18A(8) or 20B(3) in the performance or purported performance of a function of the officer or bailiff.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for or in relation to— (Amended 34 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adequacy, suitability and use of apparatus or equipment in hotels or guesthouses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reports and information to be supplied to the Authority in respect of hotels or guesthouses;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the design, structure, hygiene and sanitation of hotels or guesthouses;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the precautions to be taken against fire or other hazard likely to endanger the lives or welfare of guests in hotels or guesthouses;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: appeals under section 17A and the practice and procedure of an appeal board; (Replaced 6 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the fees to be charged for any matter prescribed or permitted by this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: generally, carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Any regulation made under this section may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the performance of particular acts without the consent of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the Authority to require or prohibit the performance of particular acts; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require particular acts to be performed to the satisfaction of the Authority.

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice in writing to the person being the operator, keeper, manager or otherwise having control of a hotel or guesthouse, waive wholly, partly or conditionally the requirements of any regulation in respect of that hotel or guesthouse and may amend or withdraw any such notice. (Amended 6 of 2020 s. 27)
Regulations made under this section may prescribe offences for contravention of the regulations, punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both. (Replaced 6 of 2020 s. 27)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence is level 6 and the maximum imprisonment is 2 years. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues may be prescribed. (Added 6 of 2020 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: Any regulation made under subsection (1)(f) may provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a different fee to be payable having regard to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the type or description of a hotel or guesthouse;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of rooms where accommodation is available in a hotel or guesthouse;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of guests able to be accommodated in a hotel or guesthouse; and (Amended 6 of 2020 s. 27)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the waiver, remission, reduction or refund of any fee.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Transitional and saving provisions for Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020
section.content: The Schedule sets out transitional and saving provisions that have effect for the purposes of the amendments made to this Ordinance by the Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (6 of 2020).

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Transitional and Saving Provisions for Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: former Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
old regime decision (舊制決定)—see section 10 of this Schedule;
old regime licence (舊制牌照)—see section 2 of this Schedule;
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 12 months beginning on the commencement date.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Old regime licence
section.content: An old regime licence is a licence issued under the former section 8, including one issued by virtue of section 7(2) of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 4 of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an old regime licence has effect under the former Part IV; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former Part IV applies in relation to an old regime licence.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Parts 2, 6 and 7—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to “licence” includes an old regime licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a “condition” of a licence includes a condition of an old regime licence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to “licensed premises” includes premises covered by an old regime licence—

subparagraph.leadIn: including any period during which the licence—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: remains in effect under the former section 9(5); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is suspended under the former section 10; but
excluding any period during which the licence has yet to take effect because of the former section 8(5)(c) or 9(3).

subsection.content: For the purposes of another Ordinance that refers to a licence under this Ordinance generally, the reference includes an old regime licence.

For the purposes of another Ordinance that refers specifically to a hotel licence under this Ordinance, the reference includes an old regime licence endorsed by the Authority as meeting the eligibility criteria for a hotel licence, but not any other old regime licence.

subsection.leadIn: An old regime licence may be renewed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it falls within subsection (2)—only under the former section 9 and subject to section 5 of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it does not fall within subsection (2)—only under section 12C in accordance with section 6 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: An old regime licence falls within this subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its licence period ends before the end of the transitional period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has not been renewed within the transitional period.

subsection.leadIn: Once an old regime licence is renewed under section 12C—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former Part IV ceases to apply in relation to the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the renewed licence ceases to be an old regime licence and is taken to be a licence as defined by section 2(1) for all purposes.

subsection.content: The licence period of an old regime licence renewed under the former section 9 must not exceed 12 months.
If an old regime licence is renewed under the former section 9, the former Fees Regulations apply in relation to the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former Fees Regulations (《原有費用規例》) means the Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Fees) Regulations (Cap. 349 sub. leg. B) as in force immediately before the date# on which Part 4 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of renewing an old regime licence under section 12C, Part 4A applies in relation to the licence, but only to the extent that would enable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the renewal of the licence as a licence that conforms with Part 4A;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the remaining in effect of the licence, if applicable, under section 12H.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), Part 4A is to be read as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the power to renew a licence under section 12C were a power to renew an old regime licence as a licence that conforms with Part 4A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following references, insofar as they relate to the old regime licence, were references to—

subparagraph.content: for a reference to “licence period”—the licence period as defined by section 1 of this Schedule;
for a reference to “condition”—a condition imposed under the former section 8(2)(a) or 9(3) or such a condition as amended or varied under the former section 10; and
for a reference to “authorized person’s certificate”—an authorized person’s certificate required to be submitted under the former section 8(5A) or 9(3A).

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made under the former section 8 for the issue of a licence under that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has yet to be determined by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is to continue to be processed under the former section 8; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former section 8 continues to apply in relation to the application.

subsection.content: The licence period of a licence issued under the former section 8 must not exceed 12 months.
If a licence is issued under the former section 8, the former Fees Regulations apply in relation to the issue.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former Fees Regulations (《原有費用規例》) means the Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Fees) Regulations (Cap. 349 sub. leg. B) as in force immediately before the date# on which Part 4 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Pending application for renewal of licence

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made under the former section 9 for the renewal of an old regime licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has yet to be determined by the Authority.

subsection.content: If, by virtue of section 4(1)(a) of this Schedule, the licence may be renewed only under the former section 9, the application is to continue to be processed under the former Part IV and subject to section 5 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If, by virtue of section 4(1)(b) of this Schedule, the licence may be renewed only under section 12C, the application is to be processed as if it were an application made under section 12C in accordance with section 6 of this Schedule, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application complies with section 12C; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: necessary steps required by the Authority to make the application comply with section 12C have been taken within a reasonable period.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Pending application for transfer of licence

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made under the former section 12 for the transfer of an old regime licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has yet to be determined by the Authority.

subsection.content: The application is to continue to be processed under the former section 12.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Old regime decision
section.content: An old regime decision is a decision of the Authority under the former section 8, 9, 10 or 12, including one made by virtue of Part 3 of this Schedule.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Appeal against old regime decision
section.content: Sections 12 and 13 of this Schedule have effect for the purposes of an appeal against an old regime decision.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of appeal has been lodged under the former section 13(3) against an old regime decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal has yet to be determined by the Appeal Board.

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions continue to apply in relation to the old regime decision and appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former Part V; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former Appeal Board Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: The following appointments remain in effect until the appeal is determined by the Appeal Board, withdrawn or abandoned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of the Chairman of the Appeal Board under the former section 14(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of the panel of persons under the former section 14(4); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the appointment of a member of the Appeal Board under the former section 15(1) to hear the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the Appeal Board constituted under the former section 15;

former Appeal Board Regulations (《原有上訴委員會規例》) means the Hotel and Guesthouse Accommodation (Appeal Board) Regulations (Cap. 349 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the date# on which Part 3 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Appeal made on or after commencement date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is entitled to appeal under the former section 13(1) against an old regime decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no notice of appeal has been lodged under the former section 13(3) against that decision.

subsection.content: This section also applies if an old regime decision is made on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: Part 5A applies in relation to the old regime decision as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in section 17A(1)—the reference to a decision of the Authority included an old regime decision;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: in sections 17A(3)(b) and 17C(2)—the reference to a notice of decision were a reference to either of the following—

subparagraph.content: a notice served under the former section 10;
an order sent under the former section 11(2).

subsection.content: This section applies to a direction given under the former section 19 that was in force immediately before the commencement date.
The direction continues to be in force under section 19 as if it were given under that section.
This section applies to an order made under the former section 20 that was in force immediately before the commencement date.
The order continues to be in force, and may be enforced, under section 20 as if it were made under that section.
